name: 1,3-bis[tris(hydroxymethyl)methylamino]propane
Reason: 1,3-Bis[tris(hydroxymethyl)methylamino]propane has a melting point that is influenced by several functional groups. The basic unit for comparison is 3-methylbutane, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius. The presence of three phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +60°C per group, totaling +180°C. Additionally, the hydroxymethyl group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +30°C. The tris(hydroxymethyl)methylamino group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +60°C. The methylamino group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +30°C. The carbonyl group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. Lastly, the propane chain introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C.
